main event: Members of the Air Force and the Ground Observer Corps spotted a strange white light in the sky that was moving slowly northwest over Pasadena, California on September 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a 'tea plate' and moved erratically, according to the Project 10073 Record Card.
The object was observed for 30 seconds through binoculars.
The report notes that the sighting could have been a balloon or an aircraft.
Lt. Mark Matlock of the Air Defense Command hurried to the roof and saw the white light pausing, jerking, and remaining stationary for a few seconds before continuing on its course.
The Los Angeles Times reported that many people in Pasadena had called about seeing the strange light in the sky.
sighted object: a white light in the sky
witnesses: members of the Air Force and the Ground Observer Corps, including Lt. Mark Matlock
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
